B678AF3516F14EDAB2492F4E1B580C2E.description: Engage in authentic research to acquire, refine, and share knowledge through written presentations and products.

F4F4457FDBF9485F92EE400CE6601945.description: Clearly state an opinion through written products, supported by examples, details, and reasoning.

DCEE14DE756046B0900CE812B3FEB472.description: Compose informative written products by introducing and developing a topic, supported by evidence (e.g. facts, examples, details) and maintaining an organized structure.

E3BF70281B0141199FE2ACAB42864510.description: Summarize and paraphrase, integrate evidence, and cite sources to create written products, research projects, and presentations for multiple purposes related to social studies content.

9A4E05B2BBDC4FCEBCA2C965DB235C68.description: Engage in collaborative discussions about appropriate topics and texts, expressing ideas clearly to others in group and whole class settings.

2F9C4EE1C86E496ABE8EA4605947CC76.description: Determine an author’s purpose and draw conclusions to evaluate how well the author’s purpose was achieved.

705D4800DA8F4CF48A71CCF511E0619B.description: Apply critical reading and thinking skills to interpret, evaluate, and respond to a variety of complex texts and perspectives.

46B8B6BDB7F7402C9850443AAC82A3D6.description: Use information from multiple print or digital sources (e.g., timelines, maps, graphs, political cartoons, images, artwork) to answer a question.

546B030205C74A379FF396379B1BB97C.description: Use information accurately from a text when explaining the text explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

1039B84A802E4059BDD701ECBCEFBF1A.description: Comprehend, evaluate, and synthesize textual sources to acquire and refine knowledge in the social studies.

1C240ABD9AF84D54AE4C9A29682E0DE6.description: The student will engage in critical, active reading of primary and secondary sources related to social studies concepts.

6F2D33D1B24E47C1B77345AC943CF000.description: Analyze the importance of innovation and entrepreneurship in a market economy.

41DEFC635BCC40DDBD05D0F424F56119.description: Explain how the concept of supply and demand operates in a market economy, using historical and contemporary examples.

12BB93309332472FB6B3B8A2820960EC.description: Demonstrate a mastery of geographic concepts and the use of geographic tools to understand the impact of geography on the past and present.

F8CDBF2159BB46F1B20F29EFA89AB1A6.description: Explain multiple causes and effects of events and developments of the past or present; create timelines to identify multiple causes and effects from given information.

353B504F9A0B4112B640596B1E6D0BE7.description: Compare perspectives of individuals and groups from different regions and experiences, including the past and present.

977D44394BDB4E418C69F7F8468F819B.description: Compare and analyze primary and secondary sources from the past and present, including the intended audience and author’s purpose.

8592B59F26F94C94AC16011728795990.description: Develop skills which demonstrate an understanding of historical events and the people who shaped our history.

34B684F84EC4401DBF00E68BE72E4144.description: Examine the principles of the Constitution of the United States, including how laws are made in a democratic society and are used to protect individual rights.

8E8853C3981E44F4BB029FCBF4F8A60D.description: Explain the structure, responsibilities, and powers exercised by officials of the national government and describe ways informed citizens can and should participate.

F0E7B33B216A4041ACA748E11498D464.description: Explain democratic principles in historic documents by identifying examples of civic virtues and principles at work in state and national settings.

8F7EA5285BC84E01B854395B176305CF.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the principles of government, the benefits of democratic systems, and their responsibilities as citizens.

B5976B9F866147C6A5C0632A1BBA855E.description: The student will use interdisciplinary tools to acquire, apply, and evaluate content understanding of the four strands of social studies.

201A922E250944809794F2B7E1600722.description: Reinforce understanding of social studies content through collaborative inquiries and the completion of authentic tasks and assessments.

E2FF6B852C344B28B4D1C427F6096AA7.description: Demonstrate critical thinking skills by frequently developing and answering various depth of knowledge questions.

4C9F81AB91014E9DA90932ABF2AF4B75.description: Compare points of agreement from reliable information used to answer supporting questions related to social studies content.

2BDCB64246E54C26AE29E5D363634EDB.description: Ask and examine essential questions that are important to others, as well as enduring across social studies topics.

AB519D201D024C9F826B4BA774C6DEB9.description: Develop practices which demonstrate an understanding that social studies involves the evaluation of evidence.

B7EBDA99844D40AFBC023B87A9E414F6.description: Explain challenges of the past and present and describe strategies used to address local, regional, or national problems.

0884F4DD24A9476BBCD4032A964ACFE8.description: Use a range of democratic procedures to discuss and make decisions about real-world problems in the community, region, and nation.

15811AB13D164ECD8FD964E5C1C98789.description: Explain how human experiences can shape a person’s point of view about civic issues.

10954A29263B4716B1CA54D62D919E77.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the virtue of civil discourse to analyze and address real- world problems.

95B5FA859D614F3CB012C139086DA647.description: The student will apply critical thinking skills to address authentic civic issues.
